entry.title: Information Overload 2010-11-07
entry.content:
• “The OS Doesn’t Matter…”:http://www.mondaynote.com/2010/10/03/the-os-doesn%E2%80%99t-matter/
    Interesting take on why OS wars don’t really matter anymore, since basically everything except for Windows has moved in a Unix direction or will do so in the near future. Quote: “This is today’s OS. User experience. Development tools.”
  • “Why newspapers make you stupid”:http://blogs.tribune.com.pk/story/2660/why-newspapers-make-you-stupid/
    On media bias and why you will need more background information and context than newspapers generally provide.
  • “TryClojure - A Call To Action”:http://blog.acidrayne.net/?p=25
    TryClojure’s author is asking for help in keeping the project alive and kicking. Check out the related “Google Group”:http://groups.google.com/group/tryclojure if you may be interested in helping out.
  • “The Fed’s $600 Billion Statement, Translated Into Plain English”:http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=131043062&ps=cprs
    The “Fed”:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Reserve_System’s latest “statement”:http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=131043062&ps=cprs in plain English. Created with this “awesome tool by Slate”:http://labs.slate.com/articles/plain-english/, there should be more articles like this.
  • “Man in disguise boards international flight”:http://www.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/americas/11/04/canada.disguised.passenger/index.html
    This week’s hilarious contribution to the aviation security circus: an Asian male boards an Air Canada flight in Hong Kong disguised as an elderly Caucasian and asks for refugee protection upon arriving in Vancouver.
  • “What Is This Devops Thing, Anyway?”:http://www.jedi.be/blog/2010/02/12/what-is-this-devops-thing-anyway/
    Now that the term “devops” is slowly becoming a bit more popular, it’s about time to find out what the hype is all about.
  • “The New War Between Science and Religion”:http://chronicle.com/article/The-New-War-Between-Science/65400/
    Maybe even more dangerous in the long run than followers of “intelligent design”, the “accommodationists” are trying to fend off science by declaring certain aspects as off-limits to scientific scrutiny.
  • “Chatbot Wears Down Proponents of Anti-Science Nonsense”:https://www.technologyreview.com/blog/mimssbits/25964/
    While I can partly understand the frustration that led to writing said bot, I don’t think that Twitter spamming people who obviously don’t care about rationale arguments is doing but worsen the divide between the religiously and the scientific minded.
  • “Fractals without a Computer!”:http://scientopia.org/blogs/goodmath/2010/11/02/fractals-without-a-computer/
    This is clever and beautiful at the same time!
  • “The graffiti knitting epidemic”:http://www.guardian.co.uk/artanddesign/2010/oct/10/graffiti-knitting
    This makes me want to learn handycraft, anyone in? ;-)
